intro: Psychotria parkeri, commonly known as the Red Psychotria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers. Its fruits are small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Psychotria parkeri is also noted for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential pharmaceutical applications.
